name: Cutting from Digestum novum
maker: Attributed to the Illustratore (Andrea da Bologna?), and Justinian
description: Cutting from Digestum novum; Attributed to the Illustratore (Andrea da Bologna?) (Italian, active 2nd quarter of 14th century), and Justinian (Greek (Byzantine), about 482 - 565, emperor 527 - 565); Bologna, Emilia-Romagna, Italy; completed before 1340; Tempera colors, gold leaf, and ink on parchment; Leaf: 14.4 × 7.6 cm (5 11/16 × 3 in.); Ms. 13; J. Paul Getty Museum, Los Angeles, California
title: Cutting from Digestum novum
medium: Tempera colors, gold leaf, and ink on parchment
